column5: Hey guys, Im finally finished school so have time to make reports again. Thank God  My buddy Bon and I hit Simcoe two weeks ago for some early season perchin. It was an awesome day. We managed to catch around 75 perch. 40 of them were between 10-13” and my bud got a 14.5” Hog. Heres a pic of the Hog.   It was a great day draggin jigs around for perch and alot of action is always good for people new to fishing.   I was planning a three day trip up to Gbay for Pike opener but the Numnuts at school messed up my marks so I had to cancel to sort things out. Managed to get out for the day this Tuesday.  Took my bud Rob out for his first real day fishing and boy was it a good one. It was a gorgeous day but I was worried about the east wind. The fish Didn’t mind the wind tho. We landed 20 fish. 19 Pike and one accidental smallie. We also lost another 10 or so fish. We caught all fish on jerk baits. A lot of  7 and 8lbers and only 3 fish under 5lbs. The real treat was that I got two Hog pike. A 10lber and a 11lber.Most fish had bigger shoulders then last year so guess there healthy. It was a blast. Here are a few of the fish.         sorry about the verticle hold guys         I really needed a day like that after a long year at school. Needless to say, my buddy Rob had a blast his first day fishing. Thanks for reading and love the Quinte reports guys.  Goodluck on the water  Snagmasteral
Nice pike man, which parts of Georgian Bay?
very nice fish! that is one big, fat perch

Ah man, I'm auctually so excited to get there at after the 24 weekend for the pike fishing,   any insight on some speciffic patterns/baits that worked well for you that you would like to share  Excellent job out there, heck I would be happy with a little 3lb'r or two let alone a 11lb pike!   Amazing job dude!
Thanks for sharing. Well deserved fish you guys got there. Sounds like you guys had a blast.
You know the season has officially begun when Snagmastrel is reporting and he's not wearing a shirt!  Great to see you back man and congrats on finishing school.

nice work!  we were out in Hoggs Bay for a few hours tuesday night with only one pike to show for it . had to keep moving to keep away from the bass.  also just about removed my skeg when we strayed out of the channel , luckily slowed down before the impact  will be out on simcoe Friday rain or shine and hope to do better  TB
Nice gators!  Can't wait to get into them myself!
Great to see you getting out again and giving us reports full of big fish. Are you done done school or just done for this year?
great report!
Some nice Pike, off to a good start...
great looking gators and some nice perch congrats

Great report and pics Snagmasteral  Great way to start the season.... oversize perch and big gators Just doesn't get any better than that.  I bet your bud Rob is real glad that he joined you on the water.  Congratulations to both of you Thanks for sharing Leechman
thanks for all the kind words guys. Ill be heading out tomorrow for yet another opener. And Im done school for good so will be fishing like crazy until i get a job
Nice report bro!
nice job gents!
Nice!!! Too bad I have to work! Cant wait to smash a few myself. Thanks for the report.
Great stuff!  19 pike in a day ain't nothin to sneeze at.
Congrats on the schooling!!!
Awesome report buddy! Those are some sweet Pike!  -Ben
thanks alot guys. I will be heading out tomorrow with johny bass to chase some eyes and maybe some whities so will have a report up on thursday. wish me luck
